bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Complaint
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States Commission Court Before James G Swan Commission

On this first day of May AD 1885 appplicand before me James G Sworn a Commisioner of the United States for the 3rd Judicial District of Wash" Territory personally appeal JG Clinger a Deputy USMarshal who harring been first duly sworn says that he has been informed and verify belives that on the night of the 30th of April AD 1885 on Leonard Martin did sell and dispose of intosicating liquor to an Indian named back Billy or his sagrraw Annie or to both of them they being condor this authority of an Judicial Asset of the U.S.within the City of Port Townsend, and another the jurisdiction of this Court County to the States of the United States in said cause made and provide and against the peace and deputy of the United States. Wherefore the said complaints and that a warrant means issue and the said Leonard Martin be dealt with according to law.
Sworn and subscribed to before me this first day of May AD 1885
US Commision Court, NO806 US. vs Leonard Martin} Selling Whisky to Indians
H, Clingon Complaint Filed May 1st 1885 James G Swan US Commision
